page.title: 16Billing Mill
page.content: A mill has stood on this site for over 900 years. In 1968 the owners of Billing Aquadrome converted the old and half-derelict Billing Water Mill into a a Milling museum. As many as 20,000 people visit it a year. It is one of a long chain of water mills on the Nene Valley. The original eel trap can still be seen next to the mill wheel. There are a collection of old grindstones including one dating from Roman times. On Wednesday 12th June we went to visit the mill. It was interesting. The water wheel made a noise. We saw a door near the roof, it was for loading the sacks of grain into the mill. There was a model of a windmill, it looked like a real windmill. There was a drive shaft from a mill at Cransley, near Kettering. There were lots of tools. A bell rang when the wheel went round. I liked going to the mill, it was good.
